The Bioresonance test results can be
used to highlight potential sensitivities to food and non

food items as well as imbalances in the body that could

Used as a holistic tool and combined with a functional medicine approach

Take time to carefully review the information provided and plan an elimination diet that works for you and
ultimately gets results

diet
so any changes that you make could very soon provide positive health and wellness improvements
An 'intolerance' is the inability to digest an item properly
whether this is a food intolerance
Intolerances can occur due to several reasons
The body is lacking the necessary digestive enzyme

cannot digest the
item properly or efficiently take the nutrients from it
A sensitivity resulting from overconsumption or over
Many symptoms are the result of a sensitivity to a particular item

If you are experiencing constant
slow
then it is possible that you are suffering from food intolerance
An allergy is an immune response to what would normally be considered a harmless substance

The immune
system perceives this substance to be a

with symptoms
usually starting within a few minutes but also as long as two hours later

Allergy symptoms can be more acute
and serious
This is not a test for allergies

this suggests that
there may be a sensitivity
intolerances and sensitivities can share some similar symptoms and triggers
results will show no reaction to an item that you know you have an allergy to

This means that
you have not shown sensitivity to that item

but in no way does it question or contradict a previous or existing
allergy diagnosis

How to identify symptoms
The identifiable symptoms can change depending on the diet and environment

meaning that an item you may
have never experienced an issue with before could suddenly be causing symptoms
This is because if you are eating or have come into contact with something

the body will usually try to
assimilate it
If your immune system is low or may you have overindulged on certain food items

then the body
will struggle to assimilate the item and will suffer from various symptoms
If you suffer from immediate symptoms upon ingesting certain foods

If the
symptoms take a while to develop
then it is likely due to food intolerance
Bioresonance is categorised under Complementary and Alternative Medicines

This covers a wide range
of therapies

including homoeopathy and acupuncture that fall outside of mainstream medicine but fit within a
functional medicine approach to health and wellness

hair sample testing using Bioresonance is recognised as a proven therapy method by practitioners
and peers Worldwide

conventional medicine does not currently recognise Bioresonance as it has not
been subject to sufficient scientific research

It is important to reiterate that this test is NOT for allergies
or allergic reactions
This test detects sensitivities and imbalances

although they can share
similar symptoms and triggers

Foods that cause the most sensitivities
Food sensitivities or intolerances arise if the body is unable to digest certain foods or drinks

This impairment
may be due to a lack of digestive enzymes or a sensitivity to certain chemicals within a food item
Most elimination diets start with the food items that cause the most trouble for animals in general

re
sensitive or intolerant to a food type
t necessarily have to remove it completely from your diet

The
key is to identify the offending food and figure out how much

of it you can consume without suffering
from symptoms or reactions

Everyday foods
It is common for someone that eats the same food every day to develop a sensitivity to that food over time

This particular item or food group could be highlighted as a moderate or high reaction item due to
overconsumption or exposure
This often happens as the body grows sensitive to that item due to the volume of food being consumed

The
body could be struggling to process or break down particular constituents of that food item

This can cause
symptoms such as bloating
Elimination of a food item during a period of time can allow the body and gut time to return to a normal state

it may be possible to reintroduce certain foods without reaction or symptoms at a more
moderate level
If you have pets and have shown a sensitivity to dog or cat hair

This simply means that you
need to be more aware of where your pet goes within your home

Make sure you try and limit their access to
bedrooms and keep them well
groomed to avoid excess hair and dander on your floors and soft furnishings

What is metal toxicity
up of large amounts of heavy metals in the soft tissues of the body

you whether you have high exposure to metal toxicity
You need to look out for significant items

to note because exposure to metals and toxicity levels are more difficult to avoid

between all the different types of heavy metals in the air
so it is crucial that you carefully analyse these results
What if your results report high exposure
You should look at lowering your day

you are eating
you can use your food items results to help you with this

along with water and cleaning
products
which tend to produce high levels of toxicity
meaning you are likely to feel ill

s detoxification processes by making sure you are consuming the right foods and drink
items for your diet
eat the right foods for your diet
and make sure you avoid processed foods

right for you

there are small amounts that are detoxified by the body and will
cause no issues
even if you think you know your body

having a greater understanding of what you may
come into contact with will eventually reduce your potential exposure
and herbicides used on crops can lead to contaminated food produce
Contaminated water can also result in fish and seafood containing metals

The pipework that water runs through is the most likely cause of any heavy metals in drinking
water
it is always best to filter your water
Pollution from vehicles such as cars
and aeroplanes contribute to heavy metals

are also ways
metals get into the air we breathe

and chromium can be found in cosmetics such
as lipstick
Some metals are added as ingredients
Everyday household cleaning products like polish

and garden
products like insecticides and pesticides contain heavy metals

VITAMINS AND MINERALS
Vitamins and minerals are essential nutrients as they perform many important roles in the body

There is a fine
line between getting enough of these nutrients and being healthy and getting too many
Eating a healthy diet remains the best way to get sufficient levels of the vitamins and minerals you need

Be
sure to replace the foods you eliminate so that you do not lose essential nutrients
Vitamins and minerals are often called micronutrients because your body needs only tiny amounts of them
Failing to get even those small quantities can lead to becoming ill or an increased risk of disease

Here is some
guidance on which functions of the body different nutrients help with
soluble vitamins enter the blood via lymph channels in the intestinal wall

soluble vitamins travel
through the body escorted by proteins that act as carriers
Fatty foods and oils are reservoirs for the four fat

Fat tissues and the liver hold these vitamins

It is possible to consume
them in doses weeks or months apart rather than daily
soluble vitamins are contained in the watery portions of the foods

They can be absorbed directly into
the bloodstream as the food is broken down during digestion or as a supplement dissolves

Because much of
your body consists of water
soluble vitamins circulate easily in your body

MINERALS
Major minerals
Major minerals are found in greater volume than trace minerals and travel through the body in various ways
potassium is absorbed and circulates into the bloodstream is excreted by the kidneys

soluble vitamin as it requires a carrier for absorption and
transport
Major Minerals have many key tasks in the body
One is to maintain the correct balance of water
chloride and potassium are key components in doing this

and magnesium ensure
continued bone health and sulfur assists protein structures that makeup hair
Too much of one of these major minerals can result in a deficiency of another

These types of imbalances are
usually caused by overconsumption of supplements rather than natural food sources

A common example of
this is an excess of sodium through consuming too much table salt

or processed foods can deplete calcium
levels in the body

This is because calcium is used to bind with sodium in order to excrete it from the body
Common major minerals

Trace minerals
Trace minerals or macrominerals still minerals

however they are found in significantly smaller quantities in the
body
They contribute to many critical functions of the body

HORMONE ANALYSIS
Hormone levels are constantly going up and down as they
re affected by a wide range of external factors

Hormone balance can be a good indicator of general
health as peoples balance tends to improve with traditional health improvements such as exercise and diet

Items listed in the hormone analysis section are hormones that your sample has shown a possible imbalance
with the percentage indicating the level of imbalance

Some people are surprised to see hormones associated
with the opposite sex in their results

every healthy person should have both oestrogen and
testosterone within their body
an imbalance in either of these is possible

s just that healthy women have
much higher levels of oestrogen compared to men

and the same goes for testosterone in men compared to
women

METABOLISM
Enzymes are essential to digestive health as they are what metabolises food within your body

helping you get
all the nutrients out of what you eat
This affects fat storage and vitamin absorption

Your test analyses for any
possible imbalance in the enzymes tested

We have tested your sample against the bioresonance of a variety of enzymes and proteins to verify levels in
your system

All items listed in your digestive health and metabolism analysis have been identified as possibly
unbalanced and could be adversely affecting your digestive health
and reducing stress will help your body to self

The percentage listed in your
report indicates how severe the imbalance detected is and does not indicate a sensitivity

SAFE ELIMINATION DIETS
What is an elimination diet
An elimination diet involves removing foods from your diet that you suspect may be triggers to symptoms
while you look for any return of symptoms
If you are suffering from a dietary intolerance

an accurate dietary history should be taken prior to trying an
elimination diet
You can use this to align with the results produced in this report

This is often a difficult process
as many processed foods include a wide variety of ingredients

A diary of your foods and any symptoms that
occur should be kept during the process of elimination and reintroduction to help you review which items are
the causes of symptoms and the level of severity
Make sure you eat other foods that provide the same nutrients as the food you need to avoid

if
you're supposed to eliminate dairy products temporarily

you'll want to look for foods that are fortified with
calcium
It is recommended that a person on an elimination diet is given a novel

food or ingredient not eaten
previously
protein or carbohydrate source if possible
Eliminating food types or ingredients for
weeks then reintroducing one at a time

keeping a diary of any
returning symptoms between reintroduction will help you understand the trigger items better

Some exclusions
of foods can take up to
weeks to fully eliminate the effects of cross

reactivity or 'hidden' ingredients in
commercial food products

affecting your health
the key is not to panic

It can be very daunting to see your health and diet laid out in a
report
s vital that you now take the time to make a plan to change your lifestyle carefully
Your health is in your hands

guidelines above or take further advice from a
nutritional therapist or nutritionist
and do seek medical advice before any large changes to your diet
